channel.title: Why cant anyone fix my problem!
channel.description:
[size=15pt]How long do I have to wait!!!!!!!!!!! Why Can't AnyOne Fix My Problem![/size]
Note: By the way I have a normal router connecting to my [color=red]WIRELESS[/color] router.
Alright people, Heres how it is, I am using a Belkin wireless router, I Portforwarded (I think), I did the No-ip and made it a no-ip.biz one but I just can't log in, Can anyone and I mean anyone help me :( :( :(
Note: I am on a Windows Vista computer
Thanks To Anyone Who Helps
Note: It seems I can not unblock the port, I port forwarded probly and everything but the port is still BLOCKED!
Note: Okay, I found the problem, For some resond the port will not unblock, I have portforwarded did it all right and I added the port to my firewall and everything but still nothing works.
Tips On Newbyest Ways To Help: Add pictures, Don't use fancey java words or any fancey words for that matter, Explain it slowly and clearly.
Pics: [IMG]http://i26.tinypic.com/2cqf9uf.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i28.tinypic.com/11lir08.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i25.tinypic.com/2u6nqkn.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i28.tinypic.com/1zlaeew.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i31.tinypic.com/5d0zeq.jpg[/img]

item.title: Why cant anyone fix my problem!
item.dc:creator: @leacher1197 leacher1197
item.description:
@leacher1197 wrote:

p00n99range:

In order for you to log into your server you have to type in this ip address when your running it “0.0.0.0” If you do not it will not allow you to log into your sever. Other people will log into your normal ip address which would be “servername.no-ip.biz” or whatever. You log in with the ip address 0.0.0.0 and they log in with the normal address.

Not even 0.0.0.0 is working for me…

EDIT:

0.0.0.0 now works for me but others can’t connect…
I have tryed utorrent and even hamachi and only hamachi works…
And hamachi sucks…

Read full topic

item.title: Why cant anyone fix my problem!
item.dc:creator: @Sp3ke Sp3ke
item.description:
@Sp3ke wrote:

[quote=“pk3r john, post:55, topic:288206”]Try to enable the port in your firewall.

So go to firewall settings (Or something close to that) and go to exceptions.
Now do “add port”. Make the name “RSPS” or whatever you like, and make the port 43594, or 5555. Whichever one you prefer. (Try both if one does not work)
Click apply, and then click ok.

Meh. Might not work, and if it doesn’t, use uTorrent. Thats what I used, and it works well.[/quote]

Utorrent dosen’t work, and I’ve turned off all my firewalls.

Didn’t help me anyway, might help the post owner.

Read full topic
item.source: Why cant anyone fix my problem!

item.title: Why cant anyone fix my problem!
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

Try to enable the port in your firewall.

So go to firewall settings (Or something close to that) and go to exceptions.
Now do “add port”. Make the name “RSPS” or whatever you like, and make the port 43594, or 5555. Whichever one you prefer. (Try both if one does not work)
Click apply, and then click ok.

Meh. Might not work, and if it doesn’t, use uTorrent. Thats what I used, and it works well.

Read full topic

@leacher1197 wrote:

[quote=“Sp3ke, post:48, topic:288206”]I’ve tryed disabling all firewalls that I’m aware of, still no luck.

I seriously have no clue why this isnt working.

Did you see any applications that both of us have?

EDIT : Do you have uTorrent / Limewire?[/quote]
I have uTorrent but I got it after I could not make a server also LimeWire is a theft program, if you enter your bank card they steal or your cash and they try to plant viruses into your programs. Avast detected a BIG virus from it when I scanned and I got from the offical site.

Errm, could I go team viewer with you and we can compare which programs we have what are the same, which could be causing the problem

EDIT :

come and connect[/quote]
I had a quick view over, Your one is the same, I have tryed to unblock the firewall port via the firewall and it did not work, It seems as if it will not unblock o.o

item.title: Why cant anyone fix my problem!
item.dc:creator: @leacher1197 leacher1197
item.description:
@leacher1197 wrote:

[quote=“Sp3ke, post:44, topic:288206”]Sorry this is irrelavent so just think of it as a free bump.

I’ve got the exact same problem, all of my ports are successfully forwarded APART from the 43594, TCP.

It’s like a program is specifically blocking that port, as I allowed access too all ports, and they all worked fine… Apart from 43594… which leads me to belive something specifically is blocking it…

Are you on Windows Vista?

EDIT : Just re-read your post and it’s an identical problem to myself. Exact same operating system, same wireless, different routers but same outcome[/quote]

Its seems like noone can fix it.
I have had TWO people over TeamViewer both that have made a server and not even they could fix it.
They searched EVERYTHING!
And they checked everything and it looked good but the port was still BLOCKED!
Also are you using VISTA HOME edition?

Read full topic

It’s like a program is specifically blocking that port, as I allowed access too all ports, and they all worked fine… Apart from 43594… which leads me to belive something specifically is blocking it…

Are you on Windows Vista?

EDIT : Just re-read your post and it’s an identical problem to myself. Exact same operating system, same wireless, different routers but same outcome

item.title: Why cant anyone fix my problem!
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

Offering cash rewards in request for help is not allowed.

Just patiently wait for someone to give you the answer, or start searching for one. Don’t try bribing just to try and get an answer faster (even if the offer was legit).

Also, crop your pictures, it’s annoying seeing the full screen.

Read full topic
item.source: Why cant anyone fix my problem!

item.title: Why cant anyone fix my problem!
item.dc:creator: @dillingo dillingo
item.description:
@dillingo wrote:

[quote=“leacher1197, post:40, topic:288206”][quote author=dillingo link=topic=381032.msg2864586#msg2864586 date=1247371662]

You have your Classpath and Path variables in the right place. Right?

Can you just download teamviewer, it’s so much easier

Can you get my a picture of what the paths are ment to look like, Like the places.

Also wth is teamviewer, Is it that thing where people can go into your computer? because sounds unsave : P

It lets people see your screen, and move your mouse. You have to accept the request and can close it at any time. I just want it to help you a lot easier, and so I can explain it better. I’ll also do your Path variables for you. It’ll just make much more sence, it’s totally safe, if someone is messing with your comp you can just close teamviewer.
[/quote]
KK, I’ll download, But what do I do after I download? how to I agree to let you have access.[/quote]
Just talk to me Via PM from now on so we can stop spamming this topic

Read full topic
